mohit@example.com.extracted_text:
Subject: Technical Assessment Project - Software Engineering Position
Dear Candidate

Thank you for your interest in the Software Engineer position at [Company Name]. We've
reviewed your application and would like to proceed with our technical assessment phase.

We believe in evaluating candidates through practical, real-world scenarios. Here's your project
challenge:

Project: Social Media Content Analyzer is an application that analyzes social media posts and
suggests engagement improvements.

Required Features:
1. Document Upload:

e Allow users to upload PDF files and image files (e.g., scanned documents).
e Support drag-and-drop or file picker interface for easy uploads.

2. Text Extraction:

e PDF Parsing: Extract text from PDFs while maintaining formatting.
OCR (Optical Character Recognition): For image files (scanned documents), extract text
using OCR technology (e.g., Tesseract).

Technical Requirements:

- Clean, production-quality code

- Basic error handling

- Loading states for better UX

- Simple documentation explaining your approach

Technical Freedom:
- Use any frameworks/technologies you're comfortable with
- Free to use Al/ML services (any free tier)
- Collect test data from public sources

Deliverables:

1. Working application URL
2. GitHub repository with source code and README

3. Brief write-up of your approach (200 words max)
Timeline:

- Project deadline: 1st Sep 2025
- Time investment: Maximum 8 hours

We'll evaluate based on:
- Problem-solving approach
- Code quality
- Working functionality
- Documentation
Next Steps:
1. Confirm receipt of this email
2. Submit your GitHub repository link and hosted application URL by the deadline
3. We'll review and respond within 3 business days

Questions? Feel free to ask. Good luck!

Best regards, [Your Name] [Company Name]

Themes Overview

The six contest themes represent real-world problem statements from Japanese
companies. Each theme comes from a different sector — EdTech, FoodTech, Agritech, Al,
Manufacturing, and Supply Chain.

e Why these themes matter: They highlight current challenges Japan and India share —
from sustainable farming and factory inspections, to knowledge transfer and food
innovation.

e What you need to do: Pick one theme that excites you and build an innovative solution
around it.

e What not to worry about: You are not expected to create a sales pitch, marketing plan,
or financial model. Instead, focus purely on ideas, concepts, and innovation.

e The big picture: These themes are designed to push you to think like innovators —
combining creativity, practicality, and an understanding of India-Japan collaboration.

Theme 1: Game-Based Learning Co., Ltd. \7 gbl, Inc
Topic: The Metrics of Play

Prompt: Create a framework to assess creativity, teamwork, or problem-solving in digital
game-based activities and build an Al tool framework that can measure non-cognitive skill
development.

Buzz Keywords: Game-based learning, EdTech, Learning Analytics

Theme Details:

e Digital games teach more than facts — they build creativity, teamwork, and problem-
solving.

e Current education systems rarely measure these “soft skills.”

e Your challenge is to design an Al-powered tool that can assess these skills while
students play.

e Think of decision-making speed, variety of solutions, collaboration patterns, and how to
make assessments seamless, not like an exam.

e Your framework should be practical, scalable, and useful for educators.

est.1885

Theme 2: Hattori Industrial Co., Ltd. () HATTOR I

Topic: Culinary Equipment Innovation

Prompt: Develop a business idea to innovate kitchen equipment to support the creation of
Japanese-inspired dishes tailored for Indian tastes at scale.

Buzz Keywords: FoodTech, Culinary Innovation, Cultural Fusion

Guidance for Students:

e Japanese food is loved worldwide, but adapting it to India faces challenges: taste
preferences, ingredient access, and cost.

e Hattori is not just about food — they create kitchen equipment for restaurants and food
services.

e Your task is to propose new or improved equipment designs that can enable chefs and
food businesses to prepare fusion dishes consistently and efficiently.

e Think about modular, scalable, or cost-effective equipment that can work in restaurants,
cafés, or cloud kitchens.

e You may also design a pilot shop concept (within the USD 80,000 hypothetical budget) to
showcase how your innovation could be tested in the Indian market.

e Focus on innovation and usability — not on marketing strategies.

Theme 3: Ishihara Sangyo Kaisha, Ltd. (ISK) ISK
_

Topic: Digital Fields, Greener Yields

Prompt: Develop a business model and strategy for India to promote smart farming
practices for farmers across India, enhancing productivity, reducing waste, and ensuring
long-term sustainability.

Buzz Keywords: Agrifech, Sustainability, Smart Farming

Guidance for Students:
e Farmers in India face low productivity, high post-harvest losses, and climate uncertainty.
e Technologies such as loT sensors, drones, precision farming, and Al-based tools exist but
adoption is slow due to cost and awareness gaps.
e Your task is to design a scalable, affordable, and farmer-friendly model that makes
smart farming more accessible.
e Consider:
o How to reduce waste in supply chains.
o Ways to improve yields and income for smallholder farmers.
o Ensuring environmental sustainability and long-term soil health.
e Think of practical solutions that can realistically be applied in rural India while being
relevant for Japanese companies exploring agricultural innovation.

@ Professionals Japan External Trade Organization

Theme 4: Geoglyph Inc. <= GEOGLYPH

Topic: Factory Intelligence

Prompt: Propose a system that analyses video and textual data to boost compliance and
reduce time spent on manual inspections.

Buzz Keywords: Compliance Tech, Al Video Analysis, Smart Manufacturing

Guidance for Students:
¢ Manufacturing companies undergo regular compliance and safety inspections (e.g., for
FDA or local regulations).
e Current inspections are time-consuming, costly, and prone to human error.
e Your challenge is to reimagine inspections with Al and 360° video, making the process
faster and more reliable.
e Consider how to:
o Automate detection of compliance issues.
o Use video and data analytics for real-time monitoring.
o Ensure solutions can adapt across different industries and factory setups.
e Focus on accuracy, efficiency, and practicality.

Theme 5: Order Busters Co., Ltd. FIFI XAID—Z.

Topic: Knowledge Capturing Al System

Prompt: Develop an innovative concept for an Al system that can capture and learn from
an individual’s tacit knowledge across diverse scenarios and varying levels of complexity.

Buzz Keywords: Tacit knowledge, Smart Learning System

Guidance for Students:
e Much of an expert’s knowledge is undocumented, experience-based, and often lost when
they retire.
e Order Busters wants to create Al agents that can observe workflows, understand
decision-making, and replicate routine tasks.
e Your solution should explore:
o How Al can capture decision-making logic and reasoning.
o Ways to use this knowledge for training new employees or improving workplace
efficiency.
o Ensuring data privacy, trust, and adaptability.
e The focus is on designing a system that enhances productivity and knowledge transfer,
not on marketing or selling.

Theme 6: Toa Software Co., Ltd. ia (2) [=|

TOA SOFTWARE COFP.

Topic: Smart Markets for Smart Produce

Prompt: Build an Al-powered system to analyse fruit and vegetable supply-demand data to
predict sales prices using past data and market trends for Japan.

Buzz Keywords: Agrifech, Predictive Analytics, Supply Chain Al

Guidance for Students:
e Fresh produce markets in Japan (and globally) face price fluctuations due to weather,
seasonal demand, and transport delays.
e These challenges affect farmers’ incomes and make it harder for retailers and
wholesalers to plan effectively.
e Your task is to design an Al tool that predicts sales and prices with high accuracy,
helping all stakeholders make better decisions.
e Consider:
o Using historical pricing, climate data, and market trends.
o Making insights easy for farmers and traders to understand and act upon.
o Helping reduce food waste and improve supply chain efficiency.
e The emphasis should be on practical, data-driven innovation that supports both Indian
and Japanese contexts.

Important Do’s and Don'ts!

™ Do's

e Choose carefully: Select the 1 theme that matches your strengths, interests, and
background.

e Understand the problem deeply: Re-explain the problem in your own words before
working ona solution.

¢ Think innovation-first: Propose a concept, system, or model that’s new and solves the
challenge effectively.

e Keep it practical: Make sure your idea is realistic, feasible, and can be scaled.

e Use the budget wisely (where applicable): If your theme includes a hypothetical budget,
design a solution that fits within it.

e Connect to Japan: Always highlight why your solution matters in the India-—Japan
context.

¢ Keep it structured: Follow the video + PPT submission format to present your idea
clearly.

X Don'ts

¢ No sales/marketing plans: This contest is about innovation, not advertising or
promotions.

¢ No vague ideas: Avoid generic suggestions without a clear model, framework, or method.

¢ Don’t ignore the theme: Off-topic or loosely related ideas will not be evaluated.

¢ No plagiarism: Ideas must be entirely your own — copying will lead to disqualification.

¢ No over-complication: Don’t suggest technology that doesn’t exist yet or is impossible
to implement.

« Don't forget relevance: Your idea should make sense in both India and Japan, not only
one context, unless otherwise specified.

Submission Guidelines

e Step 1: Check Your Theme
°o You can only change your theme once after registration.
e Step 2: Prepare Your Submission
0 Video: 5-7 min, 500 MB, 720p+, landscape.
= Must show your face, use your own voice.
» Structure: Intro ~ Problem — Solution — Plan ~ Impact > Japan
Connection — Closing.
o PPT: 10 slides max, clear & visual, supports your video.
¢ Step 3: Submit Before Deadline (Sep 25)
o Re-submission allowed — only latest entry counted.
e Rules Recap
© Original ideas only.
o Must fit chosen theme.
o Deadlines are strict.
e Checklist Slide
o Valid passport or confirmed date of receiving passport
°o 1 Theme selected and finalized
o Attend orientation for all information
°o Submit video + PPT on time

Change theme once only PPT + Video No Deadline Extensions

a
we, Professionals

Japan External Trade Organization

Video Submission

¢ Duration: 5-7 minutes (max 7).

¢ Format: Must be recorded in landscape (16:9), min. 720p.

e Visibility: Your face must be clearly visible throughout.

¢ Voice: You must narrate your idea in your own voice (no AI or external
narration).

e Upload Platform: Upload your final video to YouTube as Unlisted or
Public. Private uploads will not work (judges won’t be able to access).
Check the video’s visibility by opening it in incognito mode to be sure.

¢ Submission Method: Paste the YouTube link in the contest submission
form.

e Re-submissions: You may re-upload a new video on YouTube and
share the updated link before the deadline. Only your latest link will be
evaluated.

¢ Content flow (suggested):

o Intro - Your Name, Course, Year, University Name, Selected theme
(30-45s)

© Problem understanding (1 min)

o Proposed solution (2-3 min)

© Implementation plan (1 min)

o Impact & relevance to Japan (30-45s)

o Why Japan inspires you (personal and not generic) (30-45s)

© Conclusion (15-30s)

zy Professionals Japan External Trade Organization

PPT Submission

e File: PPTX or PDF format.
Slides: Max 10 (including title slide).
Size: Up to 100 MB.
Purpose: To visually explain your idea, not to repeat the video.
File Saving: FirstName_LastName_Theme
Recommended slides:
o Title & student details
o Chosen theme
o Proposed solution
o How it works (step-by-step)
o Feasibility (real-world applicability)
°o Impact for India & Japan
o Relevance to theme/company
o Additional notes / visuals / prototypes (if any)
°o Summary & closing

Theme 3: Ishihara Sangyo Kaisha, Ltd. (ISK) ISK
_

Topic: Digital Fields, Greener Yields

Prompt: Develop a business model and strategy for India to promote smart farming
practices for farmers across India, enhancing productivity, reducing waste, and ensuring
long-term sustainability.

Buzz Keywords: Agrifech, Sustainability, Smart Farming

Guidance for Students:
e Farmers in India face low productivity, high post-harvest losses, and climate uncertainty.
e Technologies such as loT sensors, drones, precision farming, and Al-based tools exist but
adoption is slow due to cost and awareness gaps.
e Your task is to design a scalable, affordable, and farmer-friendly model that makes
smart farming more accessible.
e Consider:
o How to reduce waste in supply chains.
o Ways to improve yields and income for smallholder farmers.
o Ensuring environmental sustainability and long-term soil health.
e Think of practical solutions that can realistically be applied in rural India while being
relevant for Japanese companies exploring agricultural innovation.

Theme 4: Geoglyph Inc. <= GEOGLYPH

Topic: Factory Intelligence

Prompt: Propose a system that analyses video and textual data to boost compliance and
reduce time spent on manual inspections.

Buzz Keywords: Compliance Tech, Al Video Analysis, Smart Manufacturing

Guidance for Students:
¢ Manufacturing companies undergo regular compliance and safety inspections (e.g., for
FDA or local regulations).
e Current inspections are time-consuming, costly, and prone to human error.
e Your challenge is to reimagine inspections with Al and 360° video, making the process
faster and more reliable.
e Consider how to:
o Automate detection of compliance issues.
o Use video and data analytics for real-time monitoring.
o Ensure solutions can adapt across different industries and factory setups.
e Focus on accuracy, efficiency, and practicality.

Theme 5: Order Busters Co., Ltd. FIFI XAID—Z.

Topic: Knowledge Capturing Al System

Prompt: Develop an innovative concept for an Al system that can capture and learn from
an individual’s tacit knowledge across diverse scenarios and varying levels of complexity.

Buzz Keywords: Tacit knowledge, Smart Learning System

Guidance for Students:
e Much of an expert’s knowledge is undocumented, experience-based, and often lost when
they retire.
e Order Busters wants to create Al agents that can observe workflows, understand
decision-making, and replicate routine tasks.
e Your solution should explore:
o How Al can capture decision-making logic and reasoning.
o Ways to use this knowledge for training new employees or improving workplace
efficiency.
o Ensuring data privacy, trust, and adaptability.
e The focus is on designing a system that enhances productivity and knowledge transfer,
not on marketing or selling.

Theme 6: Toa Software Co., Ltd. ia (2) [=|

TOA SOFTWARE COFP.

Topic: Smart Markets for Smart Produce

Prompt: Build an Al-powered system to analyse fruit and vegetable supply-demand data to
predict sales prices using past data and market trends for Japan.

Buzz Keywords: Agrifech, Predictive Analytics, Supply Chain Al

Guidance for Students:
e Fresh produce markets in Japan (and globally) face price fluctuations due to weather,
seasonal demand, and transport delays.
e These challenges affect farmers’ incomes and make it harder for retailers and
wholesalers to plan effectively.
e Your task is to design an Al tool that predicts sales and prices with high accuracy,
helping all stakeholders make better decisions.
e Consider:
o Using historical pricing, climate data, and market trends.
o Making insights easy for farmers and traders to understand and act upon.
o Helping reduce food waste and improve supply chain efficiency.
e The emphasis should be on practical, data-driven innovation that supports both Indian
and Japanese contexts.

7 Professionals

Japan External Trade Organization

Important Do’s and Don'ts!

™ Do's

e Choose carefully: Select the 1 theme that matches your strengths, interests, and
background.

e Understand the problem deeply: Re-explain the problem in your own words before
working ona solution.

¢ Think innovation-first: Propose a concept, system, or model that’s new and solves the
challenge effectively.

e Keep it practical: Make sure your idea is realistic, feasible, and can be scaled.

e Use the budget wisely (where applicable): If your theme includes a hypothetical budget,
design a solution that fits within it.

e Connect to Japan: Always highlight why your solution matters in the India-—Japan
context.

¢ Keep it structured: Follow the video + PPT submission format to present your idea
clearly.

X Don'ts

¢ No sales/marketing plans: This contest is about innovation, not advertising or
promotions.

¢ No vague ideas: Avoid generic suggestions without a clear model, framework, or method.

¢ Don’t ignore the theme: Off-topic or loosely related ideas will not be evaluated.

¢ No plagiarism: Ideas must be entirely your own — copying will lead to disqualification.

¢ No over-complication: Don’t suggest technology that doesn’t exist yet or is impossible
to implement.

« Don't forget relevance: Your idea should make sense in both India and Japan, not only
one context, unless otherwise specified.

Video Submission

¢ Duration: 5-7 minutes (max 7).

¢ Format: Must be recorded in landscape (16:9), min. 720p.

e Visibility: Your face must be clearly visible throughout.

¢ Voice: You must narrate your idea in your own voice (no AI or external
narration).

e Upload Platform: Upload your final video to YouTube as Unlisted or
Public. Private uploads will not work (judges won’t be able to access).

form.

e Re-submissions: You may re-upload a new video on YouTube and
share the updated link before the deadline. Only your latest link will be
evaluated.

o Intro - Your Name, Course, Year, University Name, Selected theme
(30-45s)

© Problem understanding (1 min)

o Impact & relevance to Japan (30-45s)

o Why Japan inspires you (personal and not generic) (30-45s)

© Conclusion (15-30s)

INI COORDINATOR

INI EXAM - 24 OCTOBER, 2025

General instructions for candidates - FN
(All timings mentioned here are in IST)

The total duration of the examination is 180 minutes.
Candidates will be permitted to leave the examination hall only after 10:30 am, on a need basis.

Hall ticket and Entry:

1. The Hall Ticket must be presented for verification along with one original photo identification (not photocopy or scanned
copy). Examples of acceptable photo identification documents are School ID, College ID, Employee ID, Driving License,
Passport, PAN card, Voter ID, and Aadhaar-ID. A printed copy of the hall ticket and original photo ID card should be brought
to the exam centre. Hall ticket and ID card copies on the phone will not be permitted.

2. This Hall Ticket is valid only if the candidate’s photograph and signature images are legible. To ensure this, print the Hall
Ticket on A4-sized paper using a laser printer, preferably a color photo printer.

3. TIMELINE: 8:00 am - Report to the examination venue | 8:40 am — Candidates will be permitted to occupy their allotted seats|
8:50 am — Candidates can login and start reading instructions prior to the examination | 9:00 am - Exam starts |
9:30 am - Gate closes, candidates will not be allowed after this time | 10:30 am Submit button will be enabled | 12:00 pm
exam ends.

P.T.O.


4. Candidates will be permitted to appear for the examination ONLY after their credentials are verified by center officials.

5. Candidates are advised to locate the examination center at least a day prior to the examination, so that they can reach the
center on time for the examination.

STATIONERY REQUIREMENTS:

e A4 sheets will be provided to candidates for rough work. Candidates have to write their name and registration number on the
A4 Sheets before they start using it. The A4 sheets must be returned to the invigilator at the end of the examination.

e On-screen calculator will be available during the exam. Candidates are advised to familiarize themselves with this virtual
Scientific calculator well ahead of the exam.
Link: https:/Awww.tcsion.com/OnlineAssessment/ScientificCalculator/Calculator.html
e You should bring your own pen/pencil; it will NOT be given at the examination centre.
DRESS CODE:
e Candidates are expected to come in professional attire to write the exams.
e Candidates wearing SHORTS will NOT be permitted inside the exam hall.
PERMITTED:
e You may bring non-electronic vehicle keys inside the exam hall.
e You are advised to carry your own drinking water in a transparent bottle.
e Candidates are allowed to bring sanitizer in a small transparent bottle.

NOT PERMITTED:

e Watches, wallets, mobile phones, Bluetooth devices, microphones, pagers, health bands or any other electronic gadgets, any
printed/blank/handwritten paper, log tables, writing pads, scales, geometry/pencil-boxes, pouches, calculators, pen drives,
electronic pens, handbags, goggles, electronic vehicle keys or similar such items are NOT allowed inside the examination
centre. There may not be any facility for the safekeeping of these devices outside the examination hall; it will be prudent not
to bring valuables to the examination center. Candidates will not be permitted to carry any food items in the exam centre.
We suggest that you bring a bag to keep routine belongings outside the exam hall. Neither INI nor the exam provider takes
responsibility for the bag and the belongings. You may keep it outside at your own risk.

MANDATORY :

e Hall tickets have to be returned to the invigilator before leaving the exam hall. No paper can be taken out of the exam hall.

e Press the SUBMIT button on the computer after you have completed the exam.

IMPORTANT:

e A basic code of conduct during the exam should be followed, failing which, INI reserves the right to take appropriate action.

e In case the exam is delayed due to any unforeseen circumstances, INI will decide on the appropriate course of action as it
deems fit.

AT THE EXAM CENTRE, IF YOU ENCOUNTER ANY ISSUES WITH RESPECT TO THE COMPUTER OR EXAM OFFICIALS,
KINDLY CONTACT THE INI EXAM REPRESENTATIVE, WHO WILL BE AVAILABLE AT THE CENTRE.

| HEREBY ACKNOWLEDGE THAT | HAVE READ, UNDERSTOOD AND AGREE TO FOLLOW THE ABOVE MENTIONED
INSTRUCTIONS.

Signature of the Candidate

Fugiat excepteur in.extracted_text:
Subject: Technical Assessment Project - Software Engineering Position
Dear Candidate

Thank you for your interest in the Software Engineer position at [Company Name]. We've
reviewed your application and would like to proceed with our technical assessment phase.

We believe in evaluating candidates through practical, real-world scenarios. Here's your project
challenge:

Project: Social Media Content Analyzer is an application that analyzes social media posts and
suggests engagement improvements.

Required Features:
1. Document Upload:

e Allow users to upload PDF files and image files (e.g., scanned documents).
e Support drag-and-drop or file picker interface for easy uploads.

2. Text Extraction:

e PDF Parsing: Extract text from PDFs while maintaining formatting.
OCR (Optical Character Recognition): For image files (scanned documents), extract text
using OCR technology (e.g., Tesseract).

Technical Requirements:

- Clean, production-quality code

- Basic error handling

- Loading states for better UX

- Simple documentation explaining your approach

Technical Freedom:
- Use any frameworks/technologies you're comfortable with
- Free to use Al/ML services (any free tier)
- Collect test data from public sources

Deliverables:

1. Working application URL
2. GitHub repository with source code and README

3. Brief write-up of your approach (200 words max)
Timeline:

- Project deadline: 1st Sep 2025
- Time investment: Maximum 8 hours

We'll evaluate based on:
- Problem-solving approach
- Code quality
- Working functionality
- Documentation
Next Steps:
1. Confirm receipt of this email
2. Submit your GitHub repository link and hosted application URL by the deadline
3. We'll review and respond within 3 business days

Questions? Feel free to ask. Good luck!

Best regards, [Your Name] [Company Name]
